My boss is in the middle of moving and her three spoiled teenagers have numerous broken laptops Lying around. She asked me to do something with them and I found "get cash for laptop". Well, the process couldn't have been easier. You fill out this form and they come up with a quote and tell you how much your laptop is worth. You hit submit and they can email you the mailing label so you don't even have to pay to ship it to them. Either that or if you need a box they'll send you a box free of charge. I had some boxes so I printed out my mailing label dropped it off at the local pack and ship and off it went. Enclosed within your mailing label is a link so you can track your package as it makes its way back to the company in Nevada.
Within 24 hours of them receiving it I received a phone call stating that one of my computers was broken Differently than I thought. I don't know it just didn't turn on so I took their word for it. Unlikely they were lying to me… In any case they still gave me over $100 for the broken laptop that was doing nothing but collecting dust. The owner, Alex, was as pleasant as could be and said that my money would be deposited into my PayPal account immediately.
I was off the phone less than two minutes when my email started beeping indicating that I had deposits made into my PayPal account. Honestly, I'm amazed. The process went better than I could've hoped & now I'm on the hunt for broken laptops so I can send to them.

review_title: Very Reputable Company and Easy People to work with.
text:
I am a type of person who always researches about a company in-depth before using the service.I highly recommend any people who are reading to use this service without any worries. The quote you see, provided you mentioned every information honestly is what you are going to be paid for your used laptop.

My story:
I was trying to resell my laptop for quite a while. After reviewing all the services and experiencing bad customer service from Dell's "Reuse and Recycle Program", I stumbled upon "GetCashForLaptop" company. At a first glance, they looked pretty reputable with high BBB reviews. I also got an awesome too good to be true deal from GCFL, who quoted my laptop for $180 (80% more than other services). I had a hard time believing so, I called the company and confirmed the quote.

A very polite gentlemen with Russian"ish" accent picked up my call. He assured me that the quote, company, and the services they provide are 100% legit. I then proceeded with the online quote, got my free shipping label and sent in my laptop. They received my laptop in 4 days and I got paid on the 5th day instantly via PayPal.

My Quote Details:
Brand: Lenovo
Model: IdeaPad Y410p
Cosmetic Condition: Poor
Functionality:Works fine with no issues (!)
Quote: $180
Quantity: 1
Total: $180

Note:
Please do not confuse Cashforlaptops.com for getcashforlaptop.com. While I was looking for the reviews one, the google showed me reviews for Cashforlaptops.com and I nearly thought they were the same company. Cashforlaptops.com is a scam. Getcashforlaptop.com is the reputable company that holds their promise.

Do your deals with Getcashforlaptop.com, I promise you that you won't regret. You will not find any other better buy-back deal for your laptop that is more convenient than Getcashforlaptop.com. I also strongly urge you guys to help promote this company, because what they are doing is good for your pocket, and the environment.

review_title: What you see is what you get
text: Professional, timely and true to their word. I had a laptop to sell, they provided a quote that I thought was fair. They sent a box and shipping label and upon receipt of my laptop, deposited the funds into my paypal account. They emailed throughout the process and provided a tracking number. My boss is in the middle of moving and her three spoiled teenagers have numerous broken laptops Lying around. She asked me to do something with them and I found "get cash for laptop". Honestly, I was a bit hesitant to send out this laptop to someone who says they're going to give me money for something that is basically worthless… But basically I figured I had absolutely nothing to lose.
Well, the process couldn't have been easier. You fill out this form and they come up with a quote and tell you how much your laptop is worth. You hit submit and they can email you the mailing label so you don't even have to pay to ship it to them. Either that or if you need a box they'll send you a box free of charge. I had some boxes so I printed out my mailing label dropped it off at the local pack and ship and off it went. Enclosed within your mailing label is a link so you can track your package as it makes its way back to the company in Nevada.
Within 24 hours of them receiving it I received a phone call stating that one of my computers was broken Differently than I thought. I don't know it just didn't turn on so I took their word for it. Unlikely they were lying to me… In any case they still gave me over $100 for the broken laptop that was doing nothing but collecting dust. The owner, Alex, was as pleasant as could be and said that my money would be deposited into my PayPal account immediately.
I was off the phone less than two minutes when my email started beeping indicating that I had deposits made into my PayPal account. Honestly, I'm amazed. The process went better than I could've hoped & now I'm on the hunt for broken laptops so I can send to them.
I cannot recommend them highly enough. I will most definitely be telling everyone I know about getcashforlaptop.com. Thank you thank you thank you

review_title: Very Reputable Company and Easy People to work with.
text:
I am a type of person who always researches about a company in-depth before using the service.I highly recommend any people who are reading to use this service without any worries. The quote you see, provided you mentioned every information honestly is what you are going to be paid for your used laptop.

My story:
I was trying to resell my laptop for quite a while. After reviewing all the services and experiencing bad customer service from Dell's "Reuse and Recycle Program", I stumbled upon "GetCashForLaptop" company. At a first glance, they looked pretty reputable with high BBB reviews. I also got an awesome too good to be true deal from GCFL, who quoted my laptop for $180 (80% more than other services). I had a hard time believing so, I called the company and confirmed the quote.

A very polite gentlemen with Russian"ish" accent picked up my call. He assured me that the quote, company, and the services they provide are 100% legit. I then proceeded with the online quote, got my free shipping label and sent in my laptop. They received my laptop in 4 days and I got paid on the 5th day instantly via PayPal.

My Quote Details:
Brand: Lenovo
Model: IdeaPad Y410p
Cosmetic Condition: Poor
Functionality:Works fine with no issues (!)
Quote: $180
Quantity: 1
Total: $180

Note:
Please do not confuse Cashforlaptops.com for getcashforlaptop.com. While I was looking for the reviews one, the google showed me reviews for Cashforlaptops.com and I nearly thought they were the same company. Cashforlaptops.com is a scam. Getcashforlaptop.com is the reputable company that holds their promise.

Do your deals with Getcashforlaptop.com, I promise you that you won't regret. You will not find any other better buy-back deal for your laptop that is more convenient than Getcashforlaptop.com. I also strongly urge you guys to help promote this company, because what they are doing is good for your pocket, and the environment.

Thank you Getcashforlaptop.com.
Very nice. They respond instantly

review_title: What you see is what you get
text: Professional, timely and true to their word. I had a laptop to sell, they provided a quote that I thought was fair. They sent a box and shipping label and upon receipt of my laptop, deposited the funds into my paypal account. They emailed throughout the process and provided a tracking number. I would recommend them to anyone. They are legitimate and trustworthy.

My boss is in the middle of moving and her three spoiled teenagers have numerous broken laptops Lying around. She asked me to do something with them and I found "get cash for laptop". Honestly, I was a bit hesitant to send out this laptop to someone who says they're going to give me money for something that is basically worthless… But basically I figured I had absolutely nothing to lose.
Well, the process couldn't have been easier. You fill out this form and they come up with a quote and tell you how much your laptop is worth. You hit submit and they can email you the mailing label so you don't even have to pay to ship it to them. Either that or if you need a box they'll send you a box free of charge. I had some boxes so I printed out my mailing label dropped it off at the local pack and ship and off it went. Enclosed within your mailing label is a link so you can track your package as it makes its way back to the company in Nevada.
Within 24 hours of them receiving it I received a phone call stating that one of my computers was broken Differently than I thought. I don't know it just didn't turn on so I took their word for it. Unlikely they were lying to me… In any case they still gave me over $100 for the broken laptop that was doing nothing but collecting dust. The owner, Alex, was as pleasant as could be and said that my money would be deposited into my PayPal account immediately.
I was off the phone less than two minutes when my email started beeping indicating that I had deposits made into my PayPal account. Honestly, I'm amazed. The process went better than I could've hoped & now I'm on the hunt for broken laptops so I can send to them.
I cannot recommend them highly enough. I will most definitely be telling everyone I know about getcashforlaptop.com. Thank you thank you thank you
